instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> not stable .
threads.message:
Water damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
I have replaced <CHIP>U7310</CHIP> mac boots up but  <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>  goes up and down around 1.769v 1.766v eventually restarts.
L7310 pin1  1.770v pin 2 1.770v
L7320 pin1  1.770v pin 2 1.69v
L7330 pin1  1.772v pin 2 1.77v
not stable as well
Thank you in advance .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> not stable .
threads.message: Does it chimes?? Can you start on SMC bypass??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> not stable .
threads.message:
Yes it does boot normal in to OS X everything works It doesnt restart anymore but <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> values are still the same, not stable

ASD all green except bluetooth mac address match.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> not stable .
threads.message: Could be anything in the Vcore circuit. I would start with replacing <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7310</CHIP>/20/30 all together.
